title: TensorFlow.js Numeric Operations Example
description: A comprehensive notebook demonstrating TensorFlow.js for numeric operations on arrays as an alternative to numpy.

cells.content:
# TensorFlow.js Numeric Operations

This notebook demonstrates how to use TensorFlow.js for numeric operations on arrays, serving as an alternative to numpy in JavaScript environments.

## Features Covered
- Tensor creation and manipulation
- Mathematical operations (sum, mean, std, etc.)
- Matrix operations
- Element-wise operations
- Statistical functions

## Conclusion

TensorFlow.js provides powerful numeric computation capabilities that can serve as an excellent alternative to numpy in JavaScript environments. Key advantages:

- **GPU Acceleration**: Automatic GPU utilization when available
- **Memory Management**: Explicit tensor disposal for optimal memory usage
- **Broadcasting**: Automatic shape handling for operations
- **Rich API**: Comprehensive mathematical and statistical functions

This makes TensorFlow.js ideal for:
- Scientific computing in Node.js
- Browser-based data analysis
- Machine learning preprocessing
- Real-time numeric computations
